intro: Tithymalus peplidion, commonly known as the narrowleaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is found in regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Tithymalus peplidion is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
